body_html:
@sugartom I was not able to get the TX1 beyond 8.0.33 (but I didn't look into this aspect very hard).

Instead I downloaded JetPack 3.0 from NVIDIA (https://developer.nvidia.com/embedded/jetpack). When I installed CUDA for my TX2, the installer downloaded "cuda-repo-l4t-8-0-local_8.0.64-1_arm64.deb" into my jetpack_download folder and proceeded to install version 8.0.64 onto my TX2.

I'm not sure how, or if it is currently possible, to install 8.0.64 on the TX1.
From NVIDIA (https://developer.nvidia.com/embedded/jetpack)

JetPack 3.0 adds support for the new Jetson TX2 Developer Kit with a preview release of L4T with kernel 4.4, and continues to support the Jetson TX1 Developer Kit and the Jetson TK1 Developer Kit. Components for Jetson TX1 and Jetson TK1 Developer Kits remain unchanged from the previous version of JetPack. (A future release of JetPack will support both Jetson TX2 and Jetson TX1 with aligned API and Linux kernel versions.)

body:
@sugartom I was not able to get the TX1 beyond 8.0.33 (but I didn't look into this aspect very hard). 

Instead I downloaded  JetPack 3.0 from NVIDIA (https://developer.nvidia.com/embedded/jetpack). When I installed CUDA for my TX2, the installer downloaded "cuda-repo-l4t-8-0-local_8.0.64-1_arm64.deb" into my jetpack_download folder and proceeded to install version 8.0.64 onto my TX2.

I'm not sure how, or if it is currently possible, to install 8.0.64 on the TX1. 
From NVIDIA (https://developer.nvidia.com/embedded/jetpack)
> JetPack 3.0 adds support for the new Jetson TX2 Developer Kit with a preview release of L4T with kernel 4.4, and continues to support the Jetson TX1 Developer Kit and the Jetson TK1 Developer Kit. Components for Jetson TX1 and Jetson TK1 Developer Kits remain unchanged from the previous version of JetPack. (A future release of JetPack will support both Jetson TX2 and Jetson TX1 with aligned API and Linux kernel versions.)
